titleStmt.title: The new non-conformist; who having obtained help of God, doth persist unto this very day; witnessing, both to small and great, some of those glorious things which the Apostles, the prophets, & Moses, did say should come to pass. Or, the voice of a careful shepherd, crying from his watch-tower at W.C. unto his little flock at W.L. with a loud voice.
titleStmt.author: Feake, Christopher, fl. 1645-1660.

titleStmt.title: The new non-conformist; who having obtained help of God, doth persist unto this very day; witnessing, both to small and great, some of those glorious things which the Apostles, the prophets, & Moses, did say should come to pass. Or, the voice of a careful shepherd, crying from his watch-tower at W.C. unto his little flock at W.L. with a loud voice.
titleStmt.author: Feake, Christopher, fl. 1645-1660.

publicationStmt.publisher: for Livewel Chapman, at the Crown in Popes-head-Alley.,

notesStmt.note: The words "from his watch-tower .. flock at W.L." are bracketed together on title page.
"A short word to the faithful remnant, who are of one spirit in the present truth, and cause of Christ", [4] p. at end.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
